title: R44608
content: The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 (Perkins IV) is a federal law supporting career and technical skills development in secondary and postsecondary education. It was reauthorized in 2006 and extended through FY2016. The House passed the Strengthening Career and Technical Education for the 21st Century Act (H.R. 5587) in 2016 to reauthorize Perkins IV through FY2022. H.R. 5587 was passed by the House in September 2016 with a vote of 405-5. The report highlights major provisions and differences between H.R. 5587 and current law. It compares provisions side-by-side and includes revised definitions. Table A-1 shows authorizations of appropriations for CTE programs under H.R. 5587. The table focuses on significant changes in overall structure, funding levels, and state/local funding formula provisions. The curr_chunk discusses various provisions of H.R. 5587, including funding levels, funding formulas, accountability measures, use of funds, national activities, and definitions.
